item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 6th January
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked directly outside my house for about a month and noone has been in or out of it since. Its a problem as im registered disabled and rely on the space for transport. Its is parked directly outside the rear of 5 dargate close Upper norwood London Se192lz

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Dargate Close, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree bush taking over pavement, starting to block and scratch people, 6th January
item.description:
This has been growing for a while now, but it is slowly taking over the space on the pavement and may present a problem for people jn wheelchairs or for parents with prams. The bush is prickly and can scratch people. It should be trimmed and if possible, treated so it doesn't grow back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blanchedowne, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black rubbish bag, 6th January
item.description:
Hi all, In front of N. 34 Baxter court there is a black rubbish bag which has been dumped there for few days. Also there is a big cardboard next to it. Please, can you kindly remove it. Best regards, Roberto.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spurstowe Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins full and litter spilling around bins, 6th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cocksure Lane, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: 4 bins possibly 149 Maiden Lanes, 6th January
item.description:
These bins have been here for about 6 months. Often obstructing the footpath. They are never emptied as they all seem to be mixed waste. They are now at a point that the lids are raised and the litter is falling out causing even more street litter than usual.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty water, 6th January
item.description:
The attached pic is dirty water coming from Southwark state office. This has been like this for over a week now and smells badly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8-20, Pocock Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bump encourages rather than prevents speeding near nursery, 6th January
item.description:
This speed bump has been here for a few months. The problem is that a car, especially larger cars / vans / trucks can easily clear it if they hit it at speed. This encourages speeding and instead hurts e.g. cyclists.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Felton Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
